definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Now, what is it that defiles?
sentences.chinese: 現在來看，什麼是污點呢？

sentences.english: She stared at the brown stain that splotched the front of her dress.
sentences.chinese: 海茨帕因痛苦而目瞪口呆，瞅着她衣服前的污點。

sentences.english: They are blotchy blood red. They smell like decaying flesh.
sentences.chinese: 花是到處帶有污點的血紅色的，聞起來像腐肉。

sentences.english: A lie is an ugly blot on a person.
sentences.chinese: 謊言是一個人醜陋的污點。

sentences.english: That's lucky. What if her name was Big Ugly Splotch ?
sentences.chinese: 真幸運她要是叫大污點怎麼辦？

sentences.english: I can't wash the spot away.
I examine a stain on the tile ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 我研究着空心天花板上的一個污點。

sentences.english: There is now no slight on her name .
sentences.chinese: 現在她的名聲上，沒有什麼污點。

sentences.english: The Spotted Cat wore a leopard skin across one shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 污點貓穿着一件斜跨在肩上的豹皮。

sentences.english: The stain of cheesiness that remains is indelible.
sentences.chinese: 奶酪上存在的污點是擦不掉的。

sentences.english: There were mud marks on Roo's shirt.
sentences.chinese: 小豆的衣服上有些泥巴的污點。

sentences.english: Just have a spotless record for the last 30 years.
sentences.chinese: 要有30年沒有污點的服刑檔案。

sentences.english: A spot is most seen on the finest cloth .
sentences.chinese: 乾淨的布上易發現污點。

sentences.english: The Human Stain is Roth's contribution which completes his famous thematic"American Trilogy".
sentences.chinese: 《人性的污點》是羅斯的“美國三部曲”的完結篇。

sentences.english: Third, the jurisprudential basis of the stain witness system is probed.
sentences.chinese: 再次，重點探討了污點證人制度的法理基礎。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
variant of 抵觸|抵触[di3 chu4]
